prompt: Graphical rule to parametrize the $Y$-variables in terms of $q$-Weyl algebra generators in the vicinity of the crossing $i$ (center) of the wiring diagram (black). A $Y$-variable situated at a vertex (blue circle) of the symmetric butterfly quiver acquires factors ${\mathrm e}^{a_i+ w_i}$, ${\mathrm e}^{b_i-u_i-w_i}$, ${\mathrm e}^{c_i+w_i}$, ${\mathrm e}^{d_i-u_i-w_i}$ from the neighboring crossing $i$ of the wiring diagram if the vertex is located at the north, east, south, west of $i$, respectively. A $Y$-variable on the vertex $i$ is ${\mathrm e}^{e_i+2u_i}$. The ordering of these factors from different $i$'s (if any) is inconsequential due to the commutativity of the associated canonical variables.
